marketNews.title: President Prabowo Proposes Scrapping Regional Elections Due to High Costs
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto on Thursday (12/12) proposed abolishing regional elections (pilkada) because their implementation is very costly. Instead, President Prabowo proposed that regional heads be elected by the DPRD, which according to a Reuters report is similar to the process during the Soeharto era. It is not known whether President Prabowo will realize this proposal into regulation. Political analyst, Yoes C. Kenawas, told Reuters that President Prabowo's proposal does not make sense and could set back democracy in Indonesia, considering that regional elections are still the best way for the public to ensure accountable regional leaders.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Aggressively Intervenes as Rupiah Nears 16,000/USD Level
marketNews.content: The Head of the Monetary Management and Securities Asset Department of Bank Indonesia, Edi Susianto, told Bloomberg that his side has intervened aggressively to contain the decline of the Rupiah, which is currently approaching the psychological level of 16,000 per US dollar. On Friday (13/12), the Rupiah weakened briefly to the level of 16,008 per US dollar, before closing down -0.43% at the level of 15,995 per US dollar. Edi stated that the Rupiah's weakening was pressured by global sentiment, with the US dollar strengthening alongside the solid US economy and escalating geopolitical tensions. The Rupiah itself has depreciated by more than -5% this quarter, according to a Bloomberg report.

marketNews.title: European Central Bank Cuts Rates by 25 bps, Projects Slower Growth
marketNews.content: The European Central Bank (ECB) on Thursday (12/12) decided to cut its benchmark interest rate by -25 bps to the level of 3.15%, in line with consensus expectations. This is the 4th rate cut during 2024 and reflects a better inflation outlook ahead, with inflation expected to fall to 2.4% in 2024, 2.1% in 2025, and 1.9% in 2026. Nevertheless, borrowing costs remain tight because previous rate hikes are still affecting existing loans. The ECB also projected a slower economic recovery than previously expected, with economic growth projected at +0.7% in 2024, +1.1% in 2025, and +1.4% in 2026.

marketNews.title: Minister of Industry: No Plan from Apple to Build Factory in Indonesia Yet; iPhone 16 Sales Permit Not Yet Issued
marketNews.content: Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, stated that there is no plan yet from Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) to build a factory in Indonesia, so the government will not yet issue sales permits for the iPhone 16 series. Agus's statement came just a few days after the Minister of Investment and Downstreaming, Rosan Roeslani, claimed that Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) has committed to investing 1 billion US dollars in Indonesia in 2026.

marketNews.title: Schroders Seeks Buyers for Indonesian Unit with $4 Billion in Assets
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that Schroders plc (LON: SDR) wants to sell its business in Indonesia as part of the plan of the company's new CEO, Richard Oldfield, who wants to streamline his underperforming investment manager units. Previously, Kontan reported in October 2024 that a subsidiary of Bank Negara Indonesia, PT BNI Asset Management (BNI AM), planned to acquire PT Schroder Investment Management Indonesia (Schroders Indonesia) from Schroders plc. Kontan stated that Schroders plc intended to sell Schroders Indonesia for 100 million US dollars, around 20-25x Schroders Indonesia's EBITDA. However, there has been no further report development regarding this issue, while BBNI's clarification to the IDX in October 2024 neither denied nor confirmed the news.

tickerNews.title: CBDK, PANI Subsidiary, Announces IPO with Valuation of IDR 17-23 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Bangun Kosambi Sukses ($CBDK), a subsidiary of Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua ($PANI), announced it will conduct an IPO by offering up to 566.89 million (10%) new shares in the price range of 3,000-4,060 per share. This implies that the IPO targets around 1.7-2.3 trillion Rupiah in proceeds, with a valuation of approximately 17-23 trillion Rupiah. CBDK operates in the PIK 2 area real estate sector, a collaboration between Agung Sedayu group and Salim group. CBDK became a subsidiary of PANI after being acquired using right issue funds in August 2022. Currently, the full prospectus for CBDK is not yet available. However, looking at CBDK's financial report as of 1H24, the company along with its subsidiaries and associated entities has a total consolidated land area of 735.2 ha, 50% of which is undeveloped land. After the IPO, CBDK shareholders will consist of PANI (45.9%), Agung Sedayu Group (22.05%), PT Tunas Mekar Jaya/Salim Group (22.05%), and the public (10%). The market cap valuation of CBDK during the IPO is still lower than its NAV valuation which reaches 107 trillion Rupiah*, with a Discount to NAV of about 78-84%. We believe this NAV is still reasonable because CBDK owns premium landbank, including CBD PIK 2. This also makes CBDK cheaper in terms of Discount to NAV compared to PANI whose market cap is already more premium than the NAV we estimate. Details of the estimated NAV for CDBK can be seen in the following table: All proceeds from the IPO will be used by CBDK for capital injection in the form of equity to its affiliate, PT Industri Pameran Nusantara, to finance the construction project for an MICE (meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions) building. Key Takeaway: After updating our NAV assumption based on the consolidated landbank owned by CBDK, the NAV of 107 trillion Rupiah represents a very significant Discount to NAV to the market cap, around 78-84%, and is larger than the property industry average. This makes CBDK's IPO valuation quite attractive. CBDK will conduct bookbuilding on December 13-20, 2024, with an estimated public offering on January 3-9, 2025, and an estimated listing date on January 13, 2025. *NAV assumption has been updated from our calculation in Stockbit Commentary published on Friday (13/12) morning, using the consolidated landbank owned by CBDK.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Transfers Majority Stake in AADI via Tender Offer, Retaining 15.4% Ownership
tickerNews.content: $ADRO: Alamtri Resources Indonesia announced that it has transferred 5.8 billion (74.6%) shares of Adaro Andalan Indonesia ($AADI) at a price of 5,960 Rupiah per share on December 9-11, 2024. The total transaction value reached 34.6 trillion Rupiah. This transaction is part of the AADI initial public offering tender offer (PUPS). After this transaction, ADRO's ownership in AADI decreased from 90% to 15.4%. In a separate information disclosure, Garibaldi Thohir and PT Adaro Strategic Investments also executed the AADI PUPS, with their respective ownership in AADI reaching 5.78% and 41.1%.

tickerNews.title: BBTN Director States Bank Acquisition to Complete in Q1 2025, Sharia Spin-off by Mid-2025
tickerNews.content: $BBTN: The President Director of Bank Tabungan Negara, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, stated that the bank acquisition process will be completed in Q1 2025, with the spin-off of its sharia business, BTN Syariah, expected to be completed by mid-2025. Previously, BBTN stated in November 2024 that the company was negotiating and arranging a conditional sale and purchase agreement to acquire a bank, although it did not elaborate further.

tickerNews.title: DOID Increases Stake in 29Metals to 19.5% Following Stage I Private Placement, Further Increase Planned
tickerNews.content: $DOID: Delta Dunia Makmur, through its business entity, Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama Pte. Ltd., announced that it has conducted Stage I new share subscription issued by DOID's business entity in the copper mining sector, 29Metals Ltd. (ASX: 29M), worth 53.8 million Australian dollars. Following this transaction, DOID's ownership in 29Metals through its subsidiary becomes 19.5%. Going forward, Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama Pte. Ltd. will conduct a Stage II share subscription in 29Metals, which will increase DOID's indirect ownership in 29Metals to 19.9%. Previously, DOID announced that the total new share subscription in 29Metals reached approximately 62.1 million Australian dollars.

tickerNews.title: CLEO Targets Double Digit Sales Growth in 2024, Expecting All-Time High Sales
tickerNews.content: $CLEO: The President Director of Sariguna Primatirta, Melisa Patricia, stated that the company targets sales growth of double digits throughout 2024, so CLEO will once again record its all-time high sales. This optimism is supported by historical sales trends which usually strengthen towards the end of the year, especially in line with increased public activity outside the home during holiday moments.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Executes Private Placement for MESOP Period II, Raising IDR 32.7 Billion
tickerNews.content: $EMTK: Elang Mahkota Teknologi announced that the company held a private placement for the MESOP implementation period II on December 11, 2024, by issuing as many as 75 million new shares at an exercise price of 436 Rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached 32.7 billion Rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ITMA Developing Mini LNG Project in East Java Worth USD 28 Million, Targeting Completion in June 2025
tickerNews.content: $ITMA: The President Director of Sumber Energi Andalan, Rocky Oktanso Sugih, stated that the company is currently working on a liquid natural gas (LNG) processing plant development project with a capacity of 2.5 mmscfd in East Java. The total investment value is about 28 million US dollars, which will be financed through bank loans and other third parties. The construction of this project is expected to be completed in June 2025, targeting additional revenue for the company of 3.8 million US dollars per year. Rocky mentioned that the LNG produced in the initial phase will be used to serve the market in Central and East Java, while the next phase development targets West Java and Bali. Rocky also said that potential customers for this project are directed towards small and medium industrial consumers who have not yet received a gas pipeline network.

tickerNews.title: BIPI Bidding on 3 Projects, Long-Term Expansion in Energy and Infrastructure Sectors
tickerNews.content: $BIPI: The President Director of Astrindo Nusantara Infrastruktur, Ray Anthony Gerungan, stated that the company is participating in tenders targeting 3 projects: 1) a waste-to-energy power plant project in Java worth 150 million US dollars, for which the feasibility study for this project has been completed; 2) a mini LNG construction project with a capacity of 10 mmscfd in Java with an investment value of 350 billion Rupiah; and 3) a renewable energy-based project. In the long term, Ray mentioned that BIPI will expand in the energy and infrastructure segment, mid-stream industry, downstream industry, and value-added green industry.

tickerNews.title: COCO Opens New Factory in Sumedang with 6,000 Ton Annual Chocolate Capacity
tickerNews.content: Wahana Interfood Nusantara ($COCO) has opened a new factory in Sumedang Regency, West Java. The President Director of COCO, Reinald Siswanto, stated that the 9,000 square meter factory has a production capacity of 6,000 tons of chocolate per year, raising the company's total production capacity to 20,000 tons per year.
